name: Poinsettia
climate: Prefers warm climates without exposure to freezing temperatures.
Thrives in tropical and subtropical regions around the world.
Cannot survive frost; best kept in temperatures above 50°F (10°C).
Temperatures below 55°F can cause leaf drop, affecting plant health.
sunlight: Requires bright, indirect sunlight for most of the day to thrive.
Exposure to direct sunlight may cause leaves to scorch and drop.
Ideal sunlight conditions are 6–8 hours of filtered light daily.
Avoid placing near drafts or heaters as it can affect sunlight absorption.
watering: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch, then water thoroughly.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; ensure proper drainage is provided.
Humidity levels should be maintained to prevent the plant from drying out.
Avoid letting the plant sit in water to prevent root disease.
soil: Prefers well-draining, slightly acidic to neutral soil compositions.
Soil should be aerated and light to promote healthy root growth.
Use a peat-based potting mix to retain moisture and prevent compaction.
Adding perlite or pumice can improve soil drainage and prevent waterlogging.
toxic: Poinsettias are mildly toxic to pets and humans, causing irritation.
If ingested, symptoms include mild stomach discomfort or vomiting.
Sap may cause allergic reactions or skin irritation in sensitive individuals.
Keep away from small children and pets to prevent accidental ingestion.
extra_care_tip: Monitor for pests such as whiteflies or aphids and treat as needed.
Prune dead or yellowing leaves to promote healthy new growth.
Turn the plant regularly to maintain even growth and exposure to light.
During the holiday season, keep away from fruit as ethylene gas affects blooms.
